meanings.definition: The retention of juvenile characteristics in an adult organism.
meanings.sent1: The paedomorphoses of the salamander meant it kept its gills even as an adult.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study paedomorphoses in certain species to understand evolutionary changes.
meanings.sent3: The paedomorphoses of the puppy made it look forever young and playful.
meanings.sent4: Her paedomorphoses were so pronounced that she was often mistaken for a teenager.
meanings.sent5: The paedomorphoses of the tree frog made it seem like it never grew up.

meanings.definition: The process of retaining juvenile traits in the adult form of an organism.
meanings.sent1: In some species, paedomorphoses is a natural part of their life cycle.
meanings.sent2: The paedomorphoses of the axolotl allow it to remain in its larval form indefinitely.
meanings.sent3: The paedomorphoses of the flower made it bloom continuously, never aging.
meanings.sent4: The paedomorphoses of the butterfly symbolized eternal youth and beauty.
meanings.sent5: The paedomorphoses of the tadpole fascinated biologists studying metamorphosis.
